column4: Hi! I just installed kubuntu. I need to recompile the kernel. Im unfamiliar with debian systems. Do I just get the latest kernel, unpack, make config   like I did in Red hat?
Is there a particular reason for rebuilding the kernel?
Problems with the KDE4 graphics + tuning.
If you really need to edit the kernel then download the kernel-source and modify the package. apt-get source linux-source
or, even, sudo apt-get install linux-source
is it an mt adapter?
mt sounds familiar.
maybe this?  Bus 001 Device 002: ID 0711:0230 Magic Control Technology Corp. MCT-232 Serial Port
the module for the MCT is mct_u232
Yes, thats a MCT-232
If you want to hack the Ubuntu kernel, see this for starters: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/KernelMaintenance
Thanks.
No... that'll be just a matter of configuring the correct module for the hardware, using /etc/modprobe.d/options (when you've found the correct options of course!)
Finding the options will take some research...
And your point is...? *grin*
Hehe, *I got puppy eyes*
I try to sort it myself, np.
Ubuntu is modular, if you want to know the exact kernel config look in /boot/config*  files - those are the options each kernel version used when building
Ah, thats why I didnt find /proc/config.gz, they have changed it.
You should know the Linux world, you have to bring along your own motivation :)
Ikonia has had experience of people out of their depth then asking for help, and causing headaches for the people here that are willing to try and help, to the frustration of all concerned

ikonia: I will repay your help by learning and helping others. So I guess I go recompile my kernel, loose the support, then come back to give support. (Probably I'll be back trying to get support inbetween :) Its faster to ask and get some directions than to have to try everything on your own. Keep the motivation up!
